boofcv.android.gui

Class VideoDisplayActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.view.ContextThemeWrapper
          • android.app.Activity
            • boofcv.android.gui.VideoDisplayActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, android.hardware.Camera.PreviewCallback, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory, android.view.LayoutInflater.Factory2, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, android.view.Window.Callback

    public abstract class VideoDisplayActivity
extends android.app.Activity
implements android.hardware.Camera.PreviewCallback

    Activity for processing and displaying video results. Use of this class can save you a considerable amount of effort if you wish to display processed video frames as an image. The actual processing of image data is done by a class provided to it via setProcessing(boofcv.android.gui.VideoProcessing).

    Shutting down and restarting the camera as the activity transitions to different phases in its life cycle is correctly handled here. The display can also be customized. User interaction and additional display widgets can be added to the activity. To access the main content view call getViewContent() and to access the video display call getViewPreview(),

    If you wish to use this class and not display a preview that is also possible. Simply set hidePreview to false. To display the FPS which the video sequence is processed at pass in true to setShowFPS(boolean),

        protected void setProgressMessage(java.lang.String message)
        Displays an indeterminate progress dialog. If the dialog is already open this will change the message being displayed. Function blocks until the dialog has been declared.
        Parameters:
